# Request for Proposal: Environmental Response Equipment (ERE)

## Request Title
ERE: 6" Trash Pump Skid Mount

## Brief Overview
The Canadian Coast Guard (CCG) is issuing a request for proposal (RFP) for the procurement of six (6) skid-mounted, self-contained 6" trash pump systems. These systems must be capable of transferring water with solids up to three inches in diameter at low pressure and high flow rates.

## Background Information
This procurement is part of the Environmental Response Equipment (ERE) Program, which aims to ensure a robust national response capability through the renewal of environmental response equipment at over 80 locations across Canada. The ERE Program replaces aging equipment and introduces new response technologies.

## Contract Details
* **Contract Title**: ERE: 6" Trash Pump Skid Mount
* **Contract Number**: F7047-220004/C
* **Procurement Category**: Goods and Services
* **Trade Agreements**: World Trade Organization Agreement on Government Procurement (WTO-AGP), Canada-European Union Comprehensive Economic and Trade Agreement (CETA), Comprehensive and Progressive Agreement for Trans-Pacific Partnership (CPTPP), and others.

## Procurement Method
All interested suppliers may submit a bid. The selection criteria are based on the lowest price.

## Contracting Entity
The contract will be awarded to the successful bidder in accordance with the Public Works and Government Services Canada's (PWGC) procurement policies.

## Tender Closing Date
Tenders must be submitted electronically using the Common Procurement Connector (CPC) service on or before August 21, 2023, at 14:00 Eastern Daylight Time (EDT). Only electronic tenders submitted through CPC will be accepted.

## Contract Documentation
Bid documents are available online at [Canada Buys](https://canadabuys.canada.ca/documents/pub/att/2023/07/11/473543a274eefa670641e5608790a410/ABES.PROD.PW_ERD.B017.E29117.EBSU000.PDF).

## Important Notes
* A debriefing or feedback session will be provided upon request to bidders who bid on the previous solicitation.
* The government retains the right to negotiate with suppliers on any procurement.
* Documents may be submitted in either official language of Canada.
* Suppliers required to have a Procurement Business Number (PBN) before contract award.
* The Phased Bid Compliance Process (PBCP) applies to this
